Move your character with [W] [A] [S] [D]. Talk to NPCs and interact with objects using [F].
Toggle between UI and Combat mode by using [Alt] or [Esc].
Press [N] to show and hide the Mini-Map. You can use it to locate quest NPCs, party members and objectives.
Clicking a blue name in the Quest log highlights that monster or NPC on your Map.
The Compass in the upper right corner marks the location of many things, like nearby quest-givers.
You can set the maximum distance between the camera and your character with Camera Maximum Distance in the Options.

Some skills inherently chain to others. When they appear on your UI, press [Space] to activate them.
You can set your own chains through the skills menu, but inherent chains will take priority.
1. Enhancement crystals can increase your abilities.
2. Equip red enhancement crystals to weapons, blue to armor, and green to rings and earrings.
1. Attuned equipment can be enchanted through the <font color="#FF0000">Activities - Enchant</font> menu.
The quest name's color and level number indicate its difficulty.
1. Party members can multiply gains by gathering at the same time from one resource.
2. The highest-skilled character determines the group's success in gathering.
Very tough monsters with skull icons in front of their names usually require a party to kill.
If a monster's eyes turn red, it is about to unleash a powerful attack.
1. Open the crafting UI [J] or visit workshops in major cities to craft equipment from gathered materials.
2. Merchants in worksops sell crafting recipes and necessary reagents.
3. There are 4 categories of craftable items: weapons, armor, alchemical consumables, and etchings.
4. Crafting consumes production points. Five production points are restored every 5 minutes. Up to 1,440 production points are restored per day.
5. You can unlock Artisan and Master crafting by leveling up a crafting skill and taking a crafting test.
1. Most equipment can be broken down (extracted) into useful crafting materials.
2. Extraction recipes can be purchased at any general goods shop.
3. Your extraction skill must be as high as the equipment tier you're trying to extract.
1. Activate glyphs to improve your skills when you reach level 20.
2. Glyphs are activated through your Skills menu. You can activate as many glyphs as your glyph points allow.
3. If you are not sure about which glyph to select, use the [Recommended Glyph] feature.
1. At level 57, join in the battlegrounds through the battle gatekeepers in major cities.
2. Exchange the medals you earn for equipment and guild consumables.
1. Form groups quickly by using the LFG function [Y] on the Social menu.
2. Or join a group in progress.
3. Select group members from the LFG applicants in the Social menu.
1. Brokers in major cities or villages help you sell to or buy items from other players.
2. When buying, you can choose to bargain with the seller or buy the item outright.
3. Payments are settled and purchased items collected through the Brokered Sales and Purchases tabs.
Use teleportals to travel to and from outlying camps and towns.
For a price, an Inventory manager can expand your inventory.
You can create a guild by clicking Create in the Guild window [G].
1. Nexuses appear at set intervals in Khanovar Front, Argonea, and Granarkus.
2. When a nexus appears, the world map and mini-map display its location.
3. Existing monsters vanish and eerie ones emerge. Kill three phases of nexus monsters to close it.
4. At Zulfikar Fortress, the Agnitor offer nexus quests, which earn you Agnitor reputation and credits.
1. Start to earn reputation at level 58 through quests from most factions. Profile > Reputation shows your progress.
2. Faction NPCs have daily quests that award reputation and credits. Daily quests can't be repeated that day.

1. Some warrior skills increase their Edge against foes.
2. The Edge count is displayed when Edge skills are used.

3. The Edge count is displayed below the enemy's HP.
4. The Edge resets if the warrior lets it lapse.
5. When the gauge changes color and displays an icon, exploit the Edge for more damage. The greater the Edge, the greater the damage.
1. Equipped gear with a red icon is eligible for enchanting. Press it to enchant. Press [T] to enchant other gear.
2. Enchanting costs feedstock and alkahest of the same or higher tier. The interface will automatically select the optimal enchanting materials.
3. The more feedstock you invest, the better the chance of success. The UI will highlight the recommended materials for the item's next enchant bonus.
4. When you have an ample amount of enchanting materials, select Auto-Enchant to enchant automatically.
1. Unless they're in a dungeon, party leaders can use raid management [B] to create a raid.
2. While in a raid, rewards from hunting decrease greatly, and you can't progress any quests except raid quests.
3. Raid leaders can shuffle the members of each team.
4. Ready checks will help ensure everyone is ready to go.
5. Raid leaders can grant invite power so others can invite players to the raid.
6. Each raid member can customize their view of buffs and debuffs for each party as they like.
You can leave your party via the Party Menu.

<Chat>
- /say (/s) + Space Bar: Chat to nearby players.
- /area (/a) + Space Bar: Chat in the area channel.
- /trade (/t) + Space Bar: Trade channel.
- /whisper (/w) [Character Name] + Space Bar: Whisper [Character Name] privately.
<Party>
- /invite [Character Name]: Invite [Character Name] to your party.
- /drop: Leave the party.
- /kick [Character Name]: Kick [Character Name] from your party.
- /disband: Disband your party. (Available only for party leaders.)
- /leader [Character Name]: Make [Character Name] the party leader.
- /LFG (/u): Post Looking for Group message.
- /party (/p) + Space Bar: Chat to your party.
- /raid (/i) + Space Bar: Chat to the raid.
- /notice (/n) + Space Bar: Send a raid/party notice. (Available only for raid/party leaders.)

<Guild>
- /guildlist : View the guild list.
- /ginvite [Character Name]: Invite [Character Name] to the guild.
- /gquit : Leave the guild.
- /gdisband : Disband guild.
<Friend>
- /friendlist : View the friend list.
- /friend [Character Name]: Add [Character Name] as a friend.
- /block [Character Name]: Block [Character Name].
- /unblock [Character Name]: Unblock [Character Name].
<Dueling>
- /duel [Character Name]: Challenge [Character Name] to a duel.
- /yield : Concede the duel.

<Chat channels>
- /make [channel] [nnnn] : Create a private chat channel (up to 8 letters) with a 4-digit numerical password.
- /chat [channel] [nnnn] : Join the [channel] private chat.
- /leave [channel] : Leave the named channel.
<Misc.>
- /follow [Character Name]: Follow [Character Name].
- /roll [x] : Roll a random number from 1-x.
- /reset : Reset all instance dungeons.
- Ctrl + Z : Hide/show all game UI.

An enchanted chest that might contain rock candy
Not all chests contain candy, so choose wisely!

Take the candy here.
Stay vigilant until you get to the boat.
Once discovered, rock candy appears on the map.
In Kumasylum, players are divided into two teams. Team Kumas and Team Feds. The object here is to get the candies from each other.
Team Feds must find candies and transport them to the designated location as fast as possible.
Team Kumas must prevent Team Feds from finding the candy and taking it to the transport spot.
